website_summaries.verdict: A dependable light-duty and lightweight chainsaw with the convenience and portability of gas without the drawbacks.
pros: Brushless motor helps extend runtime and power
Chain gauge equals 0.043 and a speed of 25.2-inch per second

customer_reviews.title: Mighty Mite
customer_reviews.text: So far just what I expected with a DeWalt product. An Excellent product This 12” blade took down this small tree with a 10” diameter. Obviously a bigger and beefer chain saw would make shorter work of this tree. But I was amazed this little guy could hang with the big saws.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Could not remove oil filler cap
customer_reviews.text: I could not remove the oil filler cap without damaging it. I then went back and read several other reviews that said the same thing. It is ridiculous to supply such a flimsy plastic cap that is screwed on so tightly that it cannot be removed without tearing it up. Returned the saw and lost money on the deal because they charged me for returning the batteries, which I had purchased separately. Shame on Dewalt for putting out such a shoddy product.
customer_reviews.author: Marconi guy

customer_reviews.title: Really
customer_reviews.text: Saw failed on 7/7/2018 return window closed 6/2/2018 What dewalt really you are better than this
customer_reviews.author: Karl P. Madinski

customer_reviews.title: Plastic toy to avoid
customer_reviews.text: You can cut a lot of 4" branches on a single 6Ah batterie but it's Very weak and slow. Chain does an horrible job at cutting 2x4" so i don't recommend it for anything else than gardening. Does not equal my cheaper gas 10" chain saw wich is unbranded and china made. Chain oil tank leaks on the shelf. I barely used it over just a year and the internal gears gave up after maybe 4-6 batteries charges...
customer_reviews.author: herald

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed and would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after Hurricane Irma knocked down some trees in my yard in South Florida - Cut thru the big palms with ease, had enough juice to log up 2 trees into about 30 small pieces to carry out to the curb. Now I use it with ease in one hand to trim up the larger branches that snapped which require me to balance on a ladder. I'm impressed and would definitely recommend it. .
customer_reviews.author: Hobineros

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous flaw
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for about ten minutes and then the motor started to pulse, causing the chain to jam on a cut.
customer_reviews.author: Martyjimbo

customer_reviews.title: Crappy product, broken out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I just opened the Amazon packaging to take the saw out for a test use. After reading the instruction I went to open the saw chain and guide bar oil cap to service it with oil for the first time. The cap is over tightened and of course the cap little flip up locking lever is missing the metal pin on one side therefore causing the plastic lever to snap. This is not my expection as I open it out of the box. I been on the phone with customer 20 mins and finally got someone on the phone. Not a satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Used it for the first time after a storm & it did a great job cutting up small to medium branches
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for light work around the farm. Used it for the first time after a storm & it did a great job cutting up small to medium branches. Battery lasted way longer than I thought & I was able to finish the clean up job. As for the bar oil cap as other reviews mentioned, I had no difficulty opening it. Make sure to look at the direction arrows on the cap for opening & closing.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne V

customer_reviews.title: cheaply made and not up to dewalt quality standards
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this saw in hopes of having something small and easy to use. The oil cap is so poorly made it snaps when trying to remove it. Saw feels cheap. Not dewalt quality
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Works great otherwise
customer_reviews.text: If the bar and chain oil didn’t leak I would have said 5 stars. Works great otherwise
customer_reviews.author: Domenic

customer_reviews.title: So much better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit worried at first. I read a million reviews, and finally jumped. Got this for my wife so we can both cut... I was worried about battery life, power, etc. All my fears are gone. The battery lasts a good long time (and I can use my other Dewalt batteries with it) and it really has super power! And I can't say how much I love having a unit I can just grab for small jobs without worrying about gas, oil, etc. We even use it in the basement to shorten some sticks when needed. Its like picking up the Dewalt drill... love it.
customer_reviews.author: Edward C. L. Hommedieu

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little chainsaw. I keep this in the back of my truck when 4 wheeling to clear the trail of small fallen trees. I love not having to worry about if it’ll start or carrying mixed gas. Everyone who has seen it has been impressed with its compact size. Fits in my truck bed drawers with ease 9/9/2019: This little guy is still kicking! Would still recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Kara B.

customer_reviews.title: Usually dewalt is where I turn...
customer_reviews.text: but this time, meh, it's ok, but leaks chain oil all over the place, so don't try to leave it full of oil unless you turn it on it's side. Not real powerful, but certainly enough for light yard work if you take your time. Not a "man's tool" more like a sensible homeowner tool that's maybe built with more of an eye towards profits than high quality. I don't give it long to survive yard work with thin, flimsy, very easy flexed plastic holding the blade, etc. Not a hard working tool, which might not be a problem but for the same money there are better options.
customer_reviews.author: Swany

customer_reviews.title: inexperienced users BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: lousy instructions ... hopeless manual design..... you need a magnifying glass and strong light to read it... there is NO "quick start guide" - - so those of you who have not had experience with a chain saw might not know it has no oil in it.. nor did they ship any with the tool... you aren't likely to struggle through the hard to read manual to gain enough knowledge that you must go to a store first to get oil... then there is how to understand the "brake"... plus the manual talks about a different battery than the one that came with it.....
customer_reviews.author: T R C

customer_reviews.title: A NEW TOY THAT LEAKS OIL
customer_reviews.text: Great saw at first I THOUGHT. It leaked oil from the beginning. The oil filler cap is pathetic and could not open or close without it trying to break. When I needed to use on a warm day, I waited too long (3 months, to return this "toy"). Too bad. Just my luck. Thankfully, I got a full refund. Lost time. Maybe a bad "batch" in production.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I need
customer_reviews.text: Based on one fall season of branch trimming, this is EXACTLY what I need for "less than firewood cutting" use... no gas & oil to mix and no cord to pull for starting means that even my wife can pick it up to cut branches off of trees to get them out of the way... saw comes with one battery, I bought two more to be able to quickly swap when one is used up, order item B074CRQPZ4 for a pair of batteries
customer_reviews.author: John Thomas Smith

customer_reviews.title: doesnt last very long
customer_reviews.text: i love the ease of use with this tool, but it shuts down by its self i don't know if i am over using it, but i am not chopping down a tree, just removing branches, the battery sometimes doesn't always charge, i bought a extra battery for it, but they dont last very long.tried to return it and also bought the extended protection plan, requested a label from amazon, when the labal came it was for the company i got it from through amazon, got a email this morning stating that it was pass the 45 daYS TO RETURN It to the Company CPO, contact asurion also got the run a round service from both companies suck
customer_reviews.author: rob'sdad

customer_reviews.title: Return was easy and appreciate the quick respo0nse
customer_reviews.text: Product worked for 30 seconds, then shorted out. Definitely not representative of the typical DeWalt quality! Return was easy and appreciate the quick respo0nse.
customer_reviews.author: Alpheus W Blizzard III

customer_reviews.title: Motor locked up
customer_reviews.text: Chainsaw would not work right out of the box. Tried adjusting the chain tension, added oil, nothing made it work. Just a grinding sound from the motor when it occasionally moved and once it actually started smoking. Sent it back. Not real sure if this was a return, based on the companies profile, but that should be stated if it is the case.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R

customer_reviews.title: Good saw but leaks oil a bit
customer_reviews.text: I like this saw but I put a 14” Oregon bar and chain on it because I just like the bigger bar and I was t a huge fan of the dewalt chain it came with. I also think it dumps a lot of bar and chain oil compared to other saws I have used in the past which is not a huge deal but would like to see it toned down a little bit. Also the oil tends to leak out when I’m not using the saw which is a little annoying
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a homeowner
customer_reviews.text: I broke up several stumps with this unit with no problems. Yes, it takes a lot of battery power, but they're rechargeable, right? And I hate to burn fossil fuels just to cut up a stump. Very lightweight, easy operation. Adding chain oil could be better (it's easy to spill), but not bad at all. This is a nice unit to have for home use - doesn't smell up your garage with gasoline fumes, and doesn't take up much space. If you've invested in other DeWalt battery-based equipment, then it really makes sense.
customer_reviews.author: Pixel_dude

customer_reviews.title: Leaks bar oil
customer_reviews.text: Leaks bar oil like crazy while stored.It appears to leak from the tensioning knob. If you store it on its left side with the tensioning knob facing up it doesn't leak. Other than that it works ok but lacks a way to firmly hold body against wood being cut.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: A really useful tool
customer_reviews.text: This has changed how much work I can do in a day in the woods. Hauling around a gas chainsaw is inconvenient and hot so I only bring it when I know 100% I must have it. The DCCS620B is quiet, uses oil sparingly and has plenty of cutting power for downing modest trees, removing branches and sectioning downed trees. It isn't quite as aggressive as my slightly larger gas chainsaw, but as an all around tool, this is far superior. It shares batteries with several other tools which is great. I can use it on and off for 6 hours and with only one battery (not continuous). I love it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Galloway

customer_reviews.title: Factory detective
customer_reviews.text: Brand new thing runs backwards Really ? I called the Dewalt service # they said take it to the service center 306 miles away Really ? I bought it on Amazon prime so I didn't have to go to town Not a happy Wood cutter ! How much wood wood a dewalt cut it a dewalt could cut wood ? NONE BACKWARDS !
customer_reviews.author: B. K

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Powerful Little Saw but Leaky
customer_reviews.text: Just received this saw today. Overall, pretty good. However, when it comes to battery powered chainsaws I've learned that time is the real test. So as I've done before, I'll update periodically. Ok, now for the good, the bad, & the ugly. Pros: Excellent battery life without sacrificing power Cuts very well & easily Lightweight/Maneuverable - easily used single-handed, if you need to Self lubricates well Solid brake Feels much more solid than most battery saws Cons: Awkward grip (to me) Flimsy plastic adjustment/lock grips Self lubricates TOO well - flings oil everywhere, nearly drains reservoir every battery Ugly: Leaks oil, badly Again, overall, I like it. We'll see in 3-4wks.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Oil reservoir leakage
customer_reviews.text: When the Sewald chainsaw arrive, I read the instructions and began to fill up the oil reservoir and noticed oil was leaking. When I turned it over there was oil spilling out.
customer_reviews.author: mario

customer_reviews.title: Not the Typical Dewalt Quality
customer_reviews.text: Product was dead on arrival. I have a lot of Dewalt power tools and never had any issue with any of them "some are 10 years old" but this product was definitely not up to a quality I am used to when using with Dewalt tools. This saw seems like it was an after thought, I would avoid the power tool.
customer_reviews.author: Colby Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Good tool to have for a homewoner or occasional tree trim
customer_reviews.text: I put this unit to the test some time ago, and it will 'time out' if used continuously for a couple of hours. I needed a total of 4 - 4Ah batteries in rotation to do this, but it outlasted me. The motor has about the same cutting torque as a small corded electric chain saw. I'd recommend anyone buying this unit to get the upgraded 40 volt battery to go along with it or any of the other DeWalt yard tools (blower, hedge clipper, string trimmer). As a homeowner and construction superintendent, the absence of mixing gas and oil to cut is a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: gotcha6

customer_reviews.title: Good product minor issue
customer_reviews.text: I love the chainsaw especially since it intergrates with my other dewalt cordless products. The no-tool chain tensioning is great. The one issue is the oil filler cap. I ran into the same problem as others have reported. You can’t turn it by hand and you think it is going to break. I found a suggestion on YouTube which worked. Take a wood dowl and place the end against one side of the cap handle then tap it with a mallet. This breaks it free then squirt a little wd40 on it and work it open and closed a couple of times, good to go. The factory should do this for you but this will take care of the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect weight for it's intended use. Add rubber O-Ring to oil filler cap
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I ordered. Super crazy fast delivery. Tested and working as it should. Haven't used it for work yet but its light weight and ease of use will make climbing and cutting a little easier.. will post again after use. 9/17/20 PS.. If your saw is leaking chain oil.. its because its missing this fantastic thing called a rubber O-Ring... it goes on the oil filler cap... try it and you will love it
customer_reviews.author: Dean L.

customer_reviews.title: Okay quality, needs more attention before boxed.
customer_reviews.text: We have most of the 20V Max tools now. This one seems to have plenty of power and works as it should. BUT.... The oil cap is a JOKE.... Assembled with no oil or lube. I had to use a little blunt chisel and a hammer to tap it loose. After getting it off and putting oil on the O Ring it turns. For the price it need some work on the Oil cap, At least lube it when It's assembled.
customer_reviews.author: LLP

customer_reviews.title: A great tool to add to your kit
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical. However I have grown so disillusioned by my gas chainsaw that I had to find an alternative. As a big Fan of The Dewalt line I read the reviews and decided to buy this saw. It’s great. Even the short 12” length is ok because coming in from the other side gives you the “reach” you might want. It’s not heavy on the arms and the saw just cuts and cuts.. I can’t find enough stuff to cut up at this point..... Can’t wait for fall!!!! DD
customer_reviews.author: DylanJDoherty

customer_reviews.title: New user and now faithful customer!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! What a great chainsaw! This little guy cut through standard brush and limbs with ease as well as medium sized tree trunks. Used up in the mountains for first time and was very impressed that the time spent cutting, the tool never once kicked back. Oil is delivered very nicely through the self oil compartment. I'm a new Dewalt V user but now a fan. I am excited to start changing out all my power tools to the one V batt. fits all system. You won't be disappointed with this purchase and I am glad I bought for all the times looking back using a hand saw. THAT won't be happening again. Smack myself for waiting this long.
customer_reviews.author: Travis M.

customer_reviews.title: GET CHAINSAW worth 2 times the price!
customer_reviews.text: I am LOVING my chainsaw! Using it everyday. Made a small log bench and big outdoor cat bed. I can't belive how much easer it us to use all day! It does go through a lot of bar oil so buy that in gallon jugs not pints! Might want to look into getting the Oregon 14in bar and chain also. Use a min of 5 ah batteries but I'm cutting dry oak with mine mostly and smaller batteries don't last long enough. This thing is light enough to pick up with 1 finger but chews through dry and cured oak no problem! Great for firewood for my cast iron stove!
customer_reviews.author: Mr Mayfield

customer_reviews.title: A workhorse!
customer_reviews.text: Spent a couple of hours on fire mitigation this afternoon using a DeWalt electric chain saw. I was a bit skeptical that it wouldn't have the power, speed, or endurance; however, having good luck with DeWalt tools I took a chance. I am elated; it has the power, is lite, and endurance handling the five trees I knocked out today with still 2/3s of the battery left producing a truckload of slash and some burning wood. Working on slopes I like the near instant stop and trigger lock; how many times I have slipped with a running chain saw. I won't get rid of my gas saw but this little guy will be doing most of the work.
customer_reviews.author: John J. Baich

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Oil Cap Design
customer_reviews.text: *Update 11/5/2018* I called DeWalt, and they are sending me a new oil cap. They were very helpful, and they had no issues sending me a new one. I've updated my rating to 4 stars for now. I'll try to update this as I get more time with it. Seriously, DeWalt! Fix the horrible oil cap design! I cannot even get it open out of the box just like so many others! This needs to be fixed ASAP. The cap broke on one side from trying to open it. See the picture. I was able to get it open with a mallet and a dull bolt. This is just bad.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Fogus

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but no
customer_reviews.text: Usually I love DeWalt products however this time I was extremely unimpressed I just recently used it to trim some branches and it struggled to cut through anything thicker than 2 inches. Also had to push heavily in order for it to even do that. Cut 5 branches and was exhausted after. I honestly can't find a reason to recommend and I honestly regret the purchase when a battery sawzall is so much cheaper and more effective.
customer_reviews.author: Elementary Watson

customer_reviews.title: Works better than advertised
customer_reviews.text: Like a lot of the existing reviews, this little saw exceeded my expectations. I put it to work immediately trimming small and large limbs and even cutting up a felled tree of approximately 12” diameter. Battery was still going strong after four hours of near-continuous use. I was really amazed at how solid this thing is based on its plastic housing. Weight is perfect too. Instructions are logical...packing was good...and ease of postoperative maintenance (cleaning) was super easy. Adjusting the chain is very simple and it maintained tension the entire four hour use. Make sure to keep an eye on the chain oil level. It uses oil like an old Harley bike!
customer_reviews.author: Rider7

customer_reviews.title: Great for light work, still need a heavy duty saw
customer_reviews.text: I love the new line of tools and batteries Dewalt is creating. This chainsaw is nice to have and lasts well with the new Flex 60/20 battery. It’s great to be able to pick it up and start cutting. No rope pulling etc. It doesn’t handle the medium and thicker trees as well. I would classify it for more light to medium work. You’ll still need a regular chainsaw in your garage. It is worth having though. Light, convenient, and easy to use. Don’t forget the chain oil and the larger 60/20 flex battery is worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: Nice saw- first time I put chain saw oil it leaked. Did not even use the saw, just returned. Dewalt know they have this problem and they should fix it.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: It's so much easier than breaking out the gasser for small jobs like limbs and small trees. I actually find that now that I have this, I almost never use the gas chainsaw. I have an acre in the north east, storms always bring down trees and limbs. I cut up quite a few with this saw this year already. The biggest caution I'll saw with this is that it's easy to forget it's a chainsaw because it is so light and quiet. I found myself breaking some of the rules and doing things I'd never do with a gasser. So just remember when you're using it, it's still a chainsaw and respect it as such.
customer_reviews.author: Dragonfly Computers

customer_reviews.title: simply impressive
customer_reviews.text: combined with the 5ah batteries this thing is a real beast. My sister owns a tree service and made fun of ky little saw, bringing out a Husqvarna that looked like it was 4 feet long. Then she played with it and was very impressed that it was battery powered. If you're a professional, this is not your saw. If you go out and cut your own firewood for the winter, you should probably buy something better. But if you're like me, a homeowner who's home is surrounded by trees and you need a saw twice a year, this thing is perfect. I've had it for a week and used it several times. Very impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lacks longevity
customer_reviews.text: This chain saw cuts very well, is light weight, and very portable for small to medium jobs around residential property. Just the right amount of power for cutting branches, larger limbs, and small trees where gas might not be the best option. After a fall of clearing brush and trimming branches, it is already leaking chain oil. Disappointed. Hoping the rest of my Dewalt 20v line doesn't turn out like this... walked in to the shed to get it tonight and found oil leaking from the bottom. Purchased in August. Shouldn't have to empty it bone dry. Barely any oil left in it.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw sucks! It doesn't have the power (even with the big battery) to cut through small to standard branches or small trees. Had to use in conjunction with my log splitter. The wood in the seller's video must've been dry as a bone. The oil flap gets jammed and breaks off easily. The bolt the keeps the chain in place broke yesterday. I've had this product less than two years. From now on, I will only purchase Dewalt's standard tools, and avoid their outdoor products. I've should've known better than to buy a battery powered chainsaw. Don't waste your time or money. Buy and gas powered or electric.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick G.

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt  Compact  20 V Chain Saw
customer_reviews.text: The One Star is for the following reason: After using for about 30 min cutting down some small trees put the saw back on my work bench. When I returned the next morning there was a significant amount of bar oil under the saw. As a result have to keep filling oil reservoir. In addition the oil leaking makes a mess staining pants jacket et. The leak is coming from the inside of the unit and not the oil fill twist cap. Update: After about a years use (home owner). It just quit. Just clicks. Re adjusted everything, brake off etc. Of course off of warranty. The Concept is good, Unfortunately the quality is not. Note made in China.
customer_reviews.author: lang

customer_reviews.title: NICE!
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. I'll probably get one of the 60v flex batteries for it since the 5AH 20v batteries don't last as long. Or I'll get a couple more of the 5AH 20v batteries. I used three to clear up some trees, and branches, that came down in a couple of storms this past winter. Needed to relearn how to cut them to make sure the bar/chain didn't get caught (had that happen a couple of times). The chain is sharp and easily cut through what I needed to. IIRC, I was able to easily go through some 8" and 10" diameter sections without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent
customer_reviews.text: A couple of my elderly neighbors had several trees growing up way too close to their foundations. Not big trees but in time they would have damaged their homes. I had never used a battery powered chain saw before, but thought I would give it a try since I had a relatively small job to perform, several palm trees and some smaller live-oaks. I was amazed at the power of this saw and the battery life. I used this almost non-stop for 5-6 hours. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Cash

customer_reviews.title: great saw
customer_reviews.text: this thing really cuts. i have large chainsaws but this is great for just a limb or two. it has the power to go after large ones also. I waited a long time for Dewalt to bring this thing out. I knew the quality would be there. LOVE IT
customer_reviews.author: lacyt

customer_reviews.title: Nice little saw
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Now have the chainsaw, weedeater, and the leaf blower, all using the same batteries. Not sure how well or if it will cut a big tree, but worked awesome cutting upper arm sized limbs and small trees that I needed it for. Tickled pink to not have to try to pull start or keep another gas tank around. 😁 Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Weis

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value, a tough little chainsaw. If you have not tired a battery operated chainsaw - or any chainsaw - give this a little time. The more familiar you get with it and the variety of tasks. you put it to, the more you begin to appreciate it. Having a compressor to blow the dirt out each time you finish using it is a great benefit. It's easy to remove the cover, blow it out clean and replace the cover, and you need to take good care of doing that if you expect it to continue doing its job.
customer_reviews.author: BIOYA

customer_reviews.title: Oil reservoir leaks
customer_reviews.text: The saw works great around the house. Buzzes right through pretty much any small trees or branches. My low rating is because of the bar oil reservoir. It leaks after use and makes a huge mess. It recommends draining the oil after every use but it’s an extreme pain and not practical. Wish they could’ve fixed this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Keep an eye on the chain and keep it tight to OEM specifications.
customer_reviews.text: Unfreaking real! Got it today 10/24/18 and not even an hour has past since I got to using it. Opened the box up skimmed through the operating manual and stuck a 6.0 amp 20V flex volt battery behind it and started cutting away. I have to say 2 1/2 hours later 4 qty trees that were 8 inch wide and about 10-12 feet in height were sawed in to 2 feet logs for the fire pit. Battery was at about 45% used up and had plenty of power and battery life left for more. Very impressed. I would recommend to others. No cords to trip on or fuel to mix. Plus smoke free.
customer_reviews.author: azriel tapias

customer_reviews.title: Worked great...at first
customer_reviews.text: Initially this was one of the better purchases I had made. Was very handy on camping trips and for hanging deer stands. On about the 4th use it began to short out; it would only run for ~1/2 second at a time. Then it quit working all together. I've tried different batteries to exclude battery failure as a variable. Will be contacting the company to see if they can make this right, will update review accordingly. Update: Shipped the saw to a service center on May 21 (paid by DeWalt). Today is July 1 and the service center does not plan on shipping it back within the next two weeks...
customer_reviews.author: Adam A.

customer_reviews.title: Excelent saw!
customer_reviews.text: I have cut 10 truckloads of dry Mesquite and willow with the original chain and bar, Just replaced the chain. With 2-3 6ah batteries I can cut a truckload of dry wood, by then i' m done. Usually need to sharpen 2-4 times per load. I use Motion lotion bar oil and the Oregon chain has been great. Thermal shutoff prevents burning up the motor. Usually kicks in when the chain is getting dull or I am cutting 20"dia. Mesquite trunks, not a problem just wait a while or cut slower. Super happy with the saw. when I wear this one out I will buy another.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN

customer_reviews.title: This.. is a NICE chainsaw.
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit, I was on the fence about whether an electric chainsaw would perform well enough. Years of NiCAD batteries and sagging performance had left a nasty taste in my mouth where performance was concerned. I'm pleased to say that this chainsaw is one of the nicer saws that I've owned. I took it outside today and used it to cut through three trees 1-1.5 feet in diameter and was not disappointed (this includes cutting limbs and sectioning for firewood) at all. It was fast to get up and running. You can kiss all of the nonsense of fiddling with a two-stroke goodbye. Pick one up for sure. You'll be a happy man.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Cumberbatch

customer_reviews.title: Darn nice chainsaw!
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe how much we cut the first time we used this, with just one fully charged battery. My wife is happy to use it too; she wouldn't touch our old gas-engine 16" chain saw. It's great for pruning and cutting up branches that come down in the tree row at the back of our property. I even cut thru a 10" limb that has been down at the back of the yard for years - very solid, dry wood and the chainsaw handled it nicely. I'm impressed!
customer_reviews.author: TKD Fan

customer_reviews.title: Dead
customer_reviews.text: Less than one year of use and it completely died. It would cost $90 just to get dewalt to look at the tool.
customer_reviews.author: Germanator

customer_reviews.title: What a great chainsaw, so powerful and lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: So I was sceptical about this saw, mainly because I only had 2-3 volt batteries and 1-1.5volt battery. Some people were saying that they would not work. Wrong! They work great! All the batteries gave me a hour to 1.5 hours of sawing. Great safety because the saw stopped immediately when the trigger was released. No lack of power. Super lightweight, can use with one hand, and super quiet compared to a gas saw. Best of all, NO pulling on a starting cord and worrying about a old gas! Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Dr.S

customer_reviews.title: The saw itself works just fine. If you do not follow the given instructions ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I have a whole family of DeWalt 20V tools. The saw itself works just fine. If you do not follow the given instructions to drain the bar/chain oil after each use you can expect the unit to leak oil which seems unique to this saw only. I have never had this problem with any of my gas saws.
customer_reviews.author: scottie2

customer_reviews.title: Beats Gas and my SawzAll
customer_reviews.text: Was using a Dewalt reciprocating saw for bushes but this thing makes it so much easier. It's so quiet it's almost dangerous b/c you forget it's still a chainsaw. It will kick and it will jump if you don't secure what you're cutting and sometimes you're so spoiled you'll operate it with one hand. Bad idea. I'm a Dewalt guy b/c all my work tools are Dewalt and most of our company uses Dewalt so it's easy for batteries. This is so much easier than trying to use a gas saw. If you're a professional, then you already know you should NOT be looking at this, but for the average home owner, this is a home run.
customer_reviews.author: George P. Burdell

customer_reviews.title: Really nice saw, I have no idea why its only 12"
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and buy the Oregon 27857 16-Inch Bar for this sucker. I was worried it would be a little under-powered but I haven't noticed any issues yet. If your worries about that then go with the Oregon 27856 14-Inch Bar. There is no reason why this saw should only have a 12" bar for 20 bucks you can upgrade this to a big boy saw. I use a 6 amp 60V Flexbolt battery. I'm not sure if that matters or not but it cuts like butter.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Woods

customer_reviews.title: Another Dewalt winner!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my God. I have other Dewalt tools, but I love this one the best. It's perfect for cutting up 8" and less logs for firewood. It's lightweight, comfortable, and no more screwing around with a gas engine! It does pretty well with a 5 ah battery. Okay with a 3 ah battery. You do need several batteries if you're going to use it for any length of time. I have two chargers so I can keep working. Don't hesitate, just buy one. You'll be very glad you did!
customer_reviews.author: Roger Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Surprising Power!
customer_reviews.text: I received this little saw about 2 weeks before hurricane Laura hit Louisiana, I purchased some 6.0 AH batteries to go with it. When everyone else was trying to get fuel and start their gas saws I was already cutting. This thing is unbeatable in spite of its size. I cut way bigger trees than what I probably should have. But I never found anything it couldn’t handle. Will probably buy another to keep in my toolbox when I travel up north.
customer_reviews.author: D Cotten

customer_reviews.title: Won’t work and No support available
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 months ago used it maybe 5 times and just Stopped working. I haveca construction company and rely on tools working especially new tools. Not sure what happened just stopped in the middle of sawing a railroad tie... The safety break seems to be working, batteries are fully charged., it makes noises. I cant find a fuse or anything else to diagnose what the problem is. . I Can’t get any support to troubleshoot. I like deWalt but they need better service for support and troubleshooting. 8-5 EST with waiting tomes more than 30mins doesn’t work for me. And is a reason not to recommend buying this or any other DeWalt product. We surely wont be buying deWalt again.
customer_reviews.author: Richardsean Construction Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Broken 15 minutes after I started...
customer_reviews.text: Seized up and stopped working about 15 minutes after I started using it. Had plenty of bar oil, and even ran it dry for 90 seconds per manufacturer recommendation. I have a feeling it was a refurb. I bought a different one, slightly older by serial number from Home Depot and it worked great. Kept this one for parts, because I don't have any follow-up with returning products, especially when they are big and awkward/pricy to send back. Could have been a bad luck of the draw, I waited to write as review until I wasn't so mad. Overall, I wasted a lot of money on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Eats Oil
customer_reviews.text: Runs great for around the farm tree limbing and such. However it 'eats' oil like crazy and leaks. You must buy vegetable grade oil for it also as it does not come with any oil. The oil dispenser stopped working after roughly 8hrs, thankfully it is still covered under manufacturer warranty, but the closest repair center is 100miles away.
customer_reviews.author: mamaKyra

customer_reviews.title: Compact but powerful
customer_reviews.text: It is small and relatively light, but very powerful. I bought this one for my son, after a neighbor loaned me theirs to cut some fallen limbs. My gas chainsaw is tough but heavy, and since it often goes months without being used, is difficult to start and runs poorly at first. This compact saw is small and easy to use, and amazingly powerful. I cut 10" limbs like a warm knife through butter, and was not worn out when I finished. I like DeWalt tools and find them to be quality designs and dependable.
customer_reviews.author: GPC

customer_reviews.title: My wife calls it hers!
customer_reviews.text: I waffled around for six months trying to decide if one of these battery operated saws would be worth it. Don’t be me, just by one. This thing works great within it’s limits. Much handier than my gas saws for limbing. My only real beef is that it is made in China. In the “Questions”, someone asked where it was made and the answer was USA of imported materials. Maybe when the response was made, but not now... Mine says CHINA. If I didn’t already have DeWalt batteries on hand, I’d send it back and go buy the Stihl.
customer_reviews.author: WileyOhio

customer_reviews.title: this thing cuts and is quiet
customer_reviews.text: i am amazed at how great this thing cuts. this is my first battery powered chainsaw and i am impressed. i am a maintenance man and i can't get over the power of this tool. the 20v is definitely enough for a normal homeowner user. very quiet and longer than expected battery life. i cut a 12 x 16 inch oval limb from a tree in my yard and it cut as good as any gas saw I've ever owned. no blue smoke, no gas, no hot muffler.
customer_reviews.author: Big jim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Solution When Your Wife Wants to Use Your Stihl to Trim Her Flower Bed!
customer_reviews.text: My wife had some Red Tip Photinias and Crape Myrtles that got out of hand. They were too much for the loppers and the Stihl was too much for the shrubs. Envision Audrey II in the "LIttle Shop of Horrors!" This was the perfect solution. It was powerful enough to get the job done but easy for her to handle. One 5ah battery did the job with power to spare. Highly recommended! Just be careful how you store it. The bar oil has a tendency to leak out.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri M.

customer_reviews.title: Battery (depending on what you put in it) goes for a long time...
customer_reviews.text: From a homeowner perspective, this worked very well for my first time out with it. It does go through bar and chain oil quite quickly, you'll easily run out of that, before you run out of battery life. It did a great job cutting through branches as I trimmed up my trees. I have not tried it on a big log, or big tree as others have, I'll leave that up to the experts. It is very light and maneuverable. or me, so far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia McB

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t just leak oil, it pours right out.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had read through reviews more carefully before purchasing this chainsaw. At first it seems great, really easy to use, lightweight, and quiet. However, to say it leaks oil is a major understatement. It literally drains oil. If you turn in on the side the oil drains out, as if you were just pouring it out. Whatever oil is left in it when you are done will be gone the next time you try to use it. AVOID this chainsaw. Losing all the oil makes it unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: I’d Buy Two Batteries - But Works GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Personally I haven’t used it (bought it for hurricane season) but I did lend it to my brother for him to cut down small pine trees at his new house and it cut down easily 30+ small pines. After hours on nonstop cutting he’d have to change the battery (of course). We lost a branch on a big oak during Hurricane Michael that was also easily cut up into small pieces to throw away. I bought two batteries in the event of a major hurricane and power outage but the chainsaw works great. Even one battery is fine if you’re in an emergency situation and need to get out.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Impressed for electric
customer_reviews.text: The chain saw works great for small jobs around the house and trimming some trees. A 5AH battery last about an hour, so as long as you have a few to switch in and out you will be fine. It does not cut as fast as a gas powered chainsaw but will get the job done. I would have to say the only down fall is that it burns through chain oil rather quickly and if it isn't sitting the right direction in storage the chain oil will leak out.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas W

customer_reviews.title: very impressive
customer_reviews.text: i was afraid to order a 20v chainsaw but gas chainsaws dont work unless you use them twice a week. received it yesterday. i had half of a 12" wide tree down and was still on first battery finally changed it out today with lithium battery from my 20v dewalt tools. it took care of large limbs and all branches so far will finish it next week. I will say i was impressed and really I didnt expect it to handle the load. I was wrong. Has me wondering just how strong the 40v is. for me 20v is good enough.
customer_reviews.author: sal

customer_reviews.title: Great little Chainsaw for smaller tasks
customer_reviews.text: I love that it takes a battery that seems to last an adequate amount of time. The battery can also be used in other 20v tools. It's nice not to have to mess with gasoline and its relatively short life span. It is very maneuverable, but strong enough to cut a variety of wood thicknesses. Overall, it's a great little saw for home use. It's short comings are is that the bar oil is pretty messy and it uses a lot. Additionally, it would be nice if DeWalt offered a small hard side chainsaw case.
customer_reviews.author: Moondoggie

customer_reviews.title: Great little chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I asked my landscaper to trim one small tree. His guy might have spent a total of ten minutes or less because it was only a couple of branches, but he charged me for an hour since it was the minimum which came out to a little over $100! I was not going to do that again so for almost the same price I just bought this chainsaw and it's already paid for itself. I used it to trim another tree in my backyard and it was so easy to use. It had no trouble cutting thru the limbs. I would highly recommend it any homeowner!
customer_reviews.author: boomer sooner

customer_reviews.title: Little powerhouse of a tool
customer_reviews.text: My husband is literally chopping anything in our yard he can get his hands on (luckily we live in the woods and have some fallen branches). When I first looked online for a chainsaw and saw this I was skeptical and my husband was definitely skeptical when I purchased it. He is in love with it now and thinks it's great for the mound of large branches that accumulate throughout the year. It's a little powerhouse.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Seim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Readily cut through even hard dead branches 8" in diameter, quickly and easily cut live trees up to 10" in diameter. Cutting ability compared favorably with my Makita corded electric chainsaw. Much easier to adjust chain tension on Dewalt saw. Battery lasts well and recharges quickly. Only issue I had was it was very difficult to open the oil filler, I almost gave up fearing I would break the plastic tab. It finally came loose.
customer_reviews.author: Peter T.

customer_reviews.title: Battery powered chainsaw that works well
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent trimmer / small log cutting chainsaw. I've used it to cut off limbs (up to 6" dia) from a fallen oak tree. It can make perhaps 20 cuts or so before slowing down. It is very easy to use, very light weight, and chews right through even very dense oak wood. It will never replace a full-sized gas powered chainsaw, but with two (larger) batteries it will absolutely work for limb removal and cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Mojave Mike

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Cordless Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I was on the fence buying this chain saw. I have always used gas powered machines to cut logs but I got tired of mixing fuel and dealing with carburetor issues. Let me tell you, this chain saw is amazing! I'm using this to cut logs to size to fit in my fireplace this winter. Just keep the battery charged ( I use 5 mAh) and you're ready to go. The chain saw has good power and best of all no fuel or start up issues! Easy to adjust the bar and chain. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: D. Kish

customer_reviews.title: A Great saw for quick emergency applications.
customer_reviews.text: This is a Great saw with plenty of power. I use it for a quick notch in a post, delimbing a downed tree or just cutting limbs to clear a trail. Battery life depends on the ah battery you have. I have used all sizes and only thing I have noticed is 1.5 through 3 ah batteries tend to heat up quickly and the saw will quit working till battery cools down. 5 and 6 ah batteries seem to be best for this saw.
customer_reviews.author: MechJT

customer_reviews.title: Automatic oiler problems
customer_reviews.text: DeWalt can not seam to design an auto bar/chain oiler that works very long. I went through four of these saws the oiler would not last and I was using Stihl bar oil, (best one can buy), and the oiler kept failing.. under warrenty for 3 years, the svc center would always replace the saw. Three of them after the original but I always had the hassle of sending it in and waiting for the replacement. I finally talking the svc cent mgr. into sending me a check for the original purchase price which took about 12 weeks. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: jb

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS badly
customer_reviews.text: Was excited until I found out how much oil this thing leaks. WOW! I live in the woods and have tons of saws, this one I thought would be good for the back of the truck. It literally slings oil out of it, leaving a trail wherever you walk. Crazy. If I was still in the return period, it would be going back.
customer_reviews.author: Mainer

customer_reviews.title: Compact, lightweight, great battery life.
customer_reviews.text: It's very nice and lightweight, battery life is excellent, but it's not very strong. I had back surgery about 6 months ago and I couldn't pull start my Stihl chainsaw or lift anything heavy, but it was nice to be able to take that out to the woods and cut out chunks of dead wood to put on my lathe. The chain is very sharp and stays sharp long as you keep it out of the dirt like most chainsaws. The only thing I don't like about it is sometimes the chain slips or the motor not sure which one, you just have to go slow and steady.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie b

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend, No Hesitations
customer_reviews.text: Excellent power, great battery life, highly recommended. This was able to cut through a 16" tree trunk when cutting half and half. Would definitely recommend for any average home use. Great for cleaning up branches that have fallen or taking in a tree with you. Be sure to watch your oil usage as the battery will run longer that it will take to go through a tank of oil. Only improvement would be to have the spikes to dig in like the larger gas saws.
customer_reviews.author: Landerz

customer_reviews.title: Saw has some flaws
customer_reviews.text: We used the saw for a while cutting up small limbs and branches etc. from a recent wind storm. Then when we tried to saw a small limb from another wind storm it just mad a weird sound and quit. It was not the battery or anything else it was just that the sound and the stopping of the saw that was the problem. I do hope others have better luck with theirs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Realize what this is for and it's limitations.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to take down a palm tree. Very soft up high, and gets much harder down below. This chainsaw is pretty light and doesn't get bothered with old gas. Cut well, but of course is limited by its length. The trunk of the Palm was just about the same as the length of the chain. I'm glad I purchased it. I've had it for months. Just it for quick limb cuts. I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Soto

customer_reviews.title: light easy. I then cut down and up 2 20 ...
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant purchasing a battery operated chain saw but this saw has done everything I wanted it to do. I trimmed a couple of trees, light easy. I then cut down and up 2 20 foot trees. Easy to handle, never lost power, and all with one 5amp battery. I told everyone at work to get one.
customer_reviews.author: A J Mucci

customer_reviews.title: Excellant!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Very powerful and great quality. Highly recommend. easy to use and have used to cut down a few trees yesterday. No problem with power as the trees had 8" trunk, Not the largest I realize, but around the house its an easy and quick solution.
customer_reviews.author: Chris F.

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome saw. I struggled with deciding to get the 60v or the 20v. I chose the 20v because i do not need asap to cut down trees. I need it for clearing falling limbs in my yard. After using it a few days Im 100% satisfied. I also purchased the 20v pole saw. Im extremely satisfied with it as well. With a 60v battery both saws last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Lake Point inc

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life...
customer_reviews.text: This thing cuts trees and limbs like warm butter. I was skeptical at first. But there’s no doubt now. The days of dealing with small gas motors and the loud noise is over. The pictures are of a large tree trunk that fell. Didn't cut it all in one charge, but there was a lot more than whats shown.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: DeWalt 20 volt Chain Saw Failure
customer_reviews.text: I loved up until it quit working with less than 2 total hours of intermintent use. Will return under warranty. Ps. I am a very experienced forester.
customer_reviews.author: Cork

customer_reviews.title: Fine Homeowner Saw (Careful with the oil fill plug !)
customer_reviews.text: purchased for home use based on many positive reviews here.....saw appears to be excellent build quality but bar and chain lube fill plug shipped dry and EXTREMELY tight. thought I was going to break the flip lever on it- but with a wrench it finally broke loose....(how about a dab of assembly lube on this DeWalt ?) charged battery installed and the saw ran like a champ. very pleased initially and I plan to install the Oregon 14" bar and chain as the saw can certainly handle it.
customer_reviews.author: timbuktu

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tool
customer_reviews.text: Love the chain saw. I have used it many times. Automatic chain oiling works well, chain tension system works well. Easy to clean with the removable cover. I bought just the bare tool and use 5 AH batteries I had from other Dewalt tools. The 5 AH battery gives plenty of time. I have used the saw to cut up to 12 inch diameter trees, works great at a bit slower pace than a corded electric or gas saw. So far very durable.
customer_reviews.author: J.G.M

customer_reviews.title: Replacement saw has different specs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw to replace my Dewalt DCCS20B that just quit working. Specs are different. I could use 14" Oregon bar and chain with 0.50 gauge and 3/8 pitch with S52 chain. On this new saw an Oregon 14" S52 bar and chain do not fit.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Very convienent to have next to my Stihl and Husquvarna saws.
customer_reviews.text: Light, handles easily, battery lasts and lasts. Typical of a small tool like this is the usual chatter when cutting dried branches, does much better with green branches. What I like most about this saw is I can use it most anywhere w/o fuel and the noise of gas saws. It cuts dried branches up to 4 inches with lots of chatter but cuts larger green well. Not quick like gas powered saws, but still gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Martin C.

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a big chainsaw guy or heavy user, but it works great for camping and around the house tree stuffs. It's light, and cuts way better than expected. I have a gas powered Stihl 16" I've used before, and although it's great, it does require gas mix and all that. So, if you're looking for a quick and easy cut, this fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Along for the Ride

customer_reviews.title: Superb Battery Life and Cuts a Full 10 Inch Wide Log
customer_reviews.text: I'm super-impressed with both the saw and battery life! Had a tall pine tree that I cut down with my main chain saw, but it was stalling out, so I used this saw (with the Oregon 27856 bar and chain recommended by another reviewer) to limb the tree and cut the trunk down until the maximum recommended 10" sections. I cut the limbs in about 6 feet sections, so many limbs were cut two or three times. This did it all on one battery charge! The picture of the tree is after I was about halfway done and there was still two lights left on the battery.
customer_reviews.author: P. Duggan

customer_reviews.title: Wow 👍
customer_reviews.text: Wow I am impressed! My smaller gas saw went missing and I don’t like having only 1 saw. Was skeptical but this thing has proved that wrong! Perfect for a homeowner just doing yard maintenance and clean up. I still drop trees with my bigger (Farm Boss 20” Stihl) but this thing is great for trimming things up. Now I’m curious how the 60v is
customer_reviews.author: Dan Dahl

product_meta.title: DEWALT DCCS620B 20V Max Compact Cordless Chainsaw Kit Bare Tool with Brushless Motor
product_meta.description: Style:No BatteryDEWALT DCCS620B 20V MAX XR Compact 12 in. Cordless Chainsaw (Tool Only).
feature_bullets: Low kick back 12" Oregon bar and chain: for construction and outdoor cutting applications
High efficiency brushless motor: maximizes run time and motor life and chain gauge 0. 043, chain speed 25. 2 feet/second
Tool free chain tensioning and bar tightening knob: for proper bar clamping force
Compact and lightweight design: Only 8. 8 pound For maximum user control and comfort. This is a bare tool Item, Battery sold separately

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,194 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
